title: Requires that all commercial insurance policies provide coverage against the loss of perishable items in the case of a black-out or power outage
summary: Requires that all commercial insurance policies provide coverage against the loss of perishable items in the case of a black-out or power outage.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         1264

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                      (PREFILED)

                                    January 5, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced by M. of A. ORTIZ, J. RIVERA, MILLMAN, PERRY, FARRELL, LENTOL
         -- read once and referred to the Committee on Insurance

       AN ACT to amend the insurance law, in relation to the inclusion of busi-
         ness interruption insurance in all commercial insurance policies

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Subsection (a) of section 3420  of  the  insurance  law  is
    2  amended by adding a new paragraph 7 to read as follows:
    3    (7)  A PROVISION IN ALL COMMERCIAL INSURANCE POLICIES PROVIDING COVER-
    4  AGE AGAINST THE LOSS OF PERISHABLE PROPERTY DUE TO A BLACK-OUT OR  POWER
    5  OUTAGE THAT LASTS TWELVE HOURS OR LONGER.
    6    S  2.  This  act  shall take effect immediately and shall apply to all
    7  policies issued, renewed, or altered on or after such effective date.






        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD03697-01-1
actClause: AN ACT to amend the insurance law, in relation to the inclusion of business interruption insurance in all commercial insurance policies
